text:
Amazon Bedrock simplifies the creation of
generative AI agents that can handle tasks like

processing sales orders, generating financial
reports, and analyzing customer retention.

However, a single agent may
struggle with specialized
or time-intensive tasks as applications grow.

Additionally, coordinating many
agents at scale is complex.

To tackle these challenges, Amazon Bedrock
offers support for multi-agent collaboration,
enabling developers to easily build, deploy,

and manage specialized agents
that work together seamlessly.

With multi-agent collaboration, developers
can create structured networks of agents,

each focused on a specific task
and guided by a supervisor agent.

This approach breaks down complex
workflows into manageable sub-tasks,

processed in parallel for
greater efficiency and accuracy.

Each agent only accesses the
data required for its role,

enhancing security and governance
while minimizing data exposure.

Businesses can scale AI-driven
workflows without manual coordination

by leveraging infrastructure as
code for repeatable deployments.

This setup also provides improved observability,
offering deeper insights into agent interactions.

Coordinating AI agents at scale, once a major
engineering challenge, is now streamlined with
Amazon Bedrockâ€™s multi-agent collaboration.

This simplifies deployment and management while
ensuring more effective and secure operations.
